snippet: Church officials are selling a former church building and garden to a developer, rejecting congregants’ plans to preserve the site for community use.
abstract: The Appraisal column on dispute over property that once housed Mormon church on 129th Street in Harlem; church officials in Utah have decided to sell property to a residential developer, rejecting two proposals to use building for community services and keep adjacent lot open for community garden and events.
lead_paragraph: Church officials are selling a former church building and garden to a developer, rejecting congregants’ plans to preserve the site for community use.

headline.seo: Mormon Church’s Plans for Land Upset Harlem
headline.main: Mormon Church’s Plans for Land Upset Harlem
headline.print_headline: Mormon Church’s Plans For Land Upset Harlem
